title: Gaza crisis: Kerry says ceasefire deal remains out of reach | World news | The Guardian
summary: israeli defense minister tells troops ground operation may 'significantly broaden ' soon .
israeli cabinet rejects ceasefire plan - government source .
kerry denies ceasefire plan submitted to israeli cabinet .
kerry says he is unable to announce a truce .

text: we 're going to wrap up our live blog coverage for the day .
here 's a summary of where things stand : diplomatic efforts in cairo led by us secretary of state john kerry failed to produce a ceasefire deal in the gaza conflict .
the diplomats were to resume work in paris on saturday .
there were signs the israeli military operation was preparing to expand .

the israeli defense minister told troops in the field , `` you need to be ready for the possibility that very soon we will instruct the military to significantly broaden the ground operation in gaza . ''
864 palestinians have been killed in the conflict and at least 5,730 have been wounded , according to the health ministry .
160,487 displaced people filled 83 unrwa shelters in gaza , according to the agency 's latest count .
two israeli soldiers were killed in gaza friday .
35 israeli soldiers have been killed since the start of the conflict .
large protests unfolded on friday in the west bank , with multiple violent clashes .
at least five palestinians were killed , including one shot dead by a settler from a passing car .
the idf said it had discovered 30 tunnels out of gaza , detroyed `` 30-40 % of hamas ' rocket arsenal '' and `` eliminated over 240 terrorists . ''
strikes on gaza continued late on friday .
an unnamed us official said netanyahu agreed to a us proposal for a 12-hour 'pause ' in strikes saturday .
hezbollah leader sayyed hassan nasrallah pledged full support on friday to `` our brothers in gaza '' .
an israeli police spokesman said a lone cell not operating under hamas leadership was responsible for the abduction and killing of three israeli teens last month .
a un team had to cut short a visit to the scene of thursday 's attackon a school in beit hanoun when it encountered gunfire .
richard engel ( @ richardengel ) no ceasefire means , this military operation could get a lot bigger .
question as seen from here in gaza seems to be when , not if .
netanyahu has told kerry that israel will begin a 12-hour `` pause '' in strikes starting at 7 am israeli time ( 0400 gmt ) on saturday , reuters reports , citing an unnamed us official .
the notion that israel will cease the assault has been greeted with healthy skepticism .
meanwhile there were reports of attacks in gaza near shifa hospital and on an ambulance in khan yunis .
a premature baby has been delivered from a woman killed in a israeli airstrike on gaza .
see bbc video here .
nicole johnston ( @ nicolealjazeera ) little baby shaima .
her mother died in an airstrike .
drs saved the baby from her womb .
# gaza
us secretary of state john kerry ( l-r ) , egyptian foreign minister sameh shoukry , and un secretary general ban ki-moon deliver a press conference in cairo , egypt , 25 july 2014 .
elfiqi/epa
the meeting in france is to be attended by envoys from the united states , britain , germany , italy , the eu , turkey and qatar , at least , french sources tell reuters .
reuters top news ( @ reuters ) france to host international meeting on saturday to try to reach ceasefire in # gaza `` as quickly as possible '' : french diplomatic source

documents.title: israeli defense minister tells troops ground operation may 'significantly broaden ' soon
text: israel 's defense minister says israel may soon broaden its ground operation in the gaza strip significantly , the ap reports : the statement by defense minister moshe yaalon was published shortly after u.s. secretary of state john kerry announced in cairo late friday that he has been unable to win agreement for a temporary weeklong cease-fire between israel and hamas .

in a statement by yaalon 's office , he is quoted as telling troops in the field that `` you need to be ready for the possibility that very soon we will instruct the military to significantly broaden the ground operation in gaza . ''

diplomatic correspondents are apart what happened behind the scenes with the ceasefire proposal reportedly rejected by israel that kerry denies proposing : matt lee ( @ apdiplowriter ) @ barakravid @ twitterid i think he is splitting hairs .
clearly something was rejected .
whether in whole or in part does n't really matter .

barak ravid is diplomatic correspondent for haaretz : barak ravid ( @ barakravid ) breaking : mod yaalon tells soldiers `` to be prepared for the possibility idf will be ordered to expand gaza ground operation very soon ''

the guardian 's patrick kingsley is at the kerry news conference in cairo : patrick kingsley ( @ patrickkingsley ) kerry : `` pm netanyahu called me a few minutes before this to tell me that that was an error , and he 's putting out a statement to that effect '' patrick kingsley ( @ patrickkingsley ) kerry : `` it 's fair to say that israel had some opposition to some concepts , but that does n't mean a proposal by any means . ''

documents.title: kerry denies ceasefire plan submitted to israeli cabinet
text: laura rozen of al-monitor reports in a remarkable string of tweets : laura rozen ( @ lrozen ) wow .
kerry says israeli gov official ( min steinitz ) was lying .
no formal proposal submitted by me for israeli cabinet to reject kerry : fiction of diplomacy and politics at the same time .
there was no formal proposal ready for a vote submitted to israel .
kerry saying israeli rumors of cabinet rejection of ceasefire was all about bibi politics .
cnn said source was steinitz kerry says the israeli cabinet stories ( cnn source here : steinitz ) just playing politics .
incredible .
laura rozen ( @ lrozen ) kerry said # israel @ twitterid said he woudl be issuing a correction .

chemi shalev ( @ chemishalev ) kerry did n't get 7 days but he extracted 12 hours humanitarian cease fire from netanyahu sheera frenkel ( @ sheeraf ) kerry is talking about a 12-hour `` downpayment '' towards a ceasefire .
we will see what happens tonight .

documents.title: kerry says he is unable to announce a truce
text: sheera frenkel ( @ sheeraf ) kerry says he 's working on a 7day ceasefire , but says he 's not announcing yet as there are differences over `` terminology . ''
jon donnison ( @ jondonnison ) kerry says netanyahu agreed to 12 hour ceasefire .
laura rozen ( @ lrozen ) kerry will go to paris to meet with parties to see if can narrow gap .
kerry is speaking in cairo .
he was preceded by egyptian foreign minister sameh shukri , who called for a seven-day truce for eid al-fitr .
patrick kingsley ( @ patrickkingsley ) egypt fm shoukry is puffing up egypt 's role in all this .
not sure he expects anyone to buy it .
kerry is reiterating the call , asking for a seven-day truce .
it appears that us secretary of state john kerry and other diplomats are getting closer to speaking in cairo .

sonia dridi ( @ sonia dridi ) they arrived and are talking close to the door , patrick kingsley ( @ patrickkingsley ) arab league are also in the house ( aka the fairmont near cairo airport ) rt @ twitterid : @ twitterid there 's a fourth one now ? !
smoke billows from a building hit by an israeli air strike in gaza city on july 25 , 2014 .
israel rejected a gaza ceasefire proposal presented by us secretary of state john kerry , israeli public television reported .

hams/afp/getty images mourners carry the body of 48-year-old hashem abu marieh , sultan awad shuqdam and abdel hamid brigheith during their funeral on july 25 , 2014 , in the beit omar village , north the west bank city of hebron .
bader/afp/getty images pro-israel demonstrators shout slogans while protesting against a pro-palestinian rally in berlin , friday , july 25 , 2014 .
schreiber/ap

israel rejected kerry 's ceasefire plan in part because it did not let israel carry on hunting down hamas 's tunnel network , reuters cites an unnamed government source as saying : [ update : us secretary of state john kerry has denied a ceasefire proposal was submitted to the israeli cabinet , saying that israeli prime minister netanyahu had apologized to kerry for the `` error '' of an israeli government official 's having announced that .
kerry said , `` it 's fair to say that israel had some opposition to some concepts , but that does n't mean a proposal by any means . ''
read more here . ]

israel rejected on friday international proposals for a ceasefire in its fight against islamist militants in gaza , but is discussing changes to the truce plan with u.s. secretary of state john kerry , a government source said .

mediators hope that a truce could come into force ahead of a muslim festival that starts early next week , but they have struggled to resolve seemingly irreconcilable demands from israel and hamas-led fighters , locked in conflict since july 8 .
hamas , which wants an end to an israeli-egyptian blockade of gaza before agreeing to halt hostilities , has yet to respond to the ceasefire proposition , which has not been made public .

the israeli source , who declined to be named , said prime minister binyamin netanyahu 's security cabinet had turned down the plan because it did not let israel carry on hunting down hamas 's tunnel network that criss-crosses the gaza border .
`` kerry 's proposal leans ( too much ) towards hamas 's demands , '' said the source .

israeli cabinet rejects us proposal for 'humanitarian pause ' in gaza fighting - our story by harriet sherwood in jerusalem , ian black and patrick kingsley in cairo is here : the israeli decision , reported by israel 's channel 2 tv , left the us secretary of state , john kerry , struggling to find a way to continue his efforts to halt the bloodshed .

[ update : us secretary of state john kerry has denied a ceasefire proposal was submitted to the israeli cabinet , saying that israeli prime minister netanyahu had apologized to kerry for the `` error '' of an israeli government official 's having announced that .
kerry said , `` it 's fair to say that israel had some opposition to some concepts , but that does n't mean a proposal by any means . ''
read more here . ]

documents.title: israeli cabinet rejects ceasefire plan - government source
text: [ update : us secretary of state john kerry has denied a ceasefire proposal was submitted to the israeli cabinet , saying that israeli prime minister netanyahu had apologized to kerry for the `` error '' of an israeli government official 's having announced that .
kerry said , `` it 's fair to say that israel had some opposition to some concepts , but that does n't mean a proposal by any means . ''
read more here . ]

israel prime minister binyamin netanyahu 's security cabinet has rejected proposals for a ceasefire in the gaza strip and is seeking changes to the plans , reuters reports , citing an unnamed government source : us secretary of state john kerry has been pushing for a halt to 18 days of fighting between israel and hamas islamist militants in the gaza strip .
full details of the proposed truce have not been released , but the government official , who declined to be named , said israel wanted modifications before agreeing to any end to hostilities .
hamas has yet to respond to the proposed ceasefire .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : israel media : israel 's security cabinet unanimously rejects kerry 's proposal for gaza truce .
the us editor of haaretz reports whispers of a pending rejection on the israeli side of a john kerry ceasefire plan .
developing .
chemi shalev ( @ chemishalev ) breaking : ok , @ twitterid now tells channel 10 that israeli cabinet will reject kerry cease fire proposal ( or accept it in name only ? )
chemi shalev ( @ chemishalev ) @ lrozen have to wait for more info , but perhaps political mood ( and cabinet ) is such that even tactical ok to cease fire may be too much
as we continue our live blog coverage , here 's a summary of where things stand : large protests unfolded in the west bank , with multiple violent clashes .
at least five palestinians were killed , including one shot dead by a settler from a passing car .
two israeli soldiers were killed in gaza friday , the military said , bringing israeli army losses in the conflict to 35 .
848 palestinians have been killed including 208 children and more than 5,500 have been wounded , according to the latest health ministry figures .
more than 160,000 gazans have been displaced in the conflict , according to the latest un figures .
hezbollah leader sayyed hassan nasrallah pledged full support on friday to `` our brothers in gaza '' .
the world health organization called on friday for a humanitarian corridor to be set up in gaza to allow for evacuations and aid worker access .
us secretary of state john kerry was expected to speak in cairo alongside his egyptian counterpart and un representatives .
egypt has been trying to foster a ceasefire plan .
an israeli police spokesman said a lone cell not operating under hamas leadership was responsible for the abduction and killing of three israeli teens last month .
a un team had to cut short a visit to the scene of thursday 's attack on a school in beit hanoun when it encountered gunfire .
pro-palestinian marches played around the world .
french authorities banned a demonstration planned in paris for saturday .
waiting for the diplomats to speak in cairo .
sangwon yoon ( @ sangwonyoon ) drumroll ?
who else is coming ?
# gaza # cairo

hezbollah leader sayyed hassan nasrallah pledged full support on friday to `` our brothers in gaza '' despite a deep rift between the two militant organisations over the civil war in syria , reuters reports : `` we in hezbollah will be unstinting in all forms of support , assistance and aid that we are able to provide , '' nasrallah said .

`` we feel we are true partners with this resistance , a partnership of jihad , brotherhood , hope , pain , sacrifice and fate , because their victory is all our victory , and their defeat is all our defeat , '' he said .

lebanon 's hezbollah leader sayyed hassan nasrallah makes a rare public appearance as he addresses his supporters during a rally to mark `` quds ( jerusalem ) day '' in beirut 's southern suburbs july 25 , 2014 .

karim/reuters nasrallah delivered his speech in public in hezbollah 's stronghold of south beirut , a rare event for the militant shi'ite lebanese leader who has lived in hiding , fearing for his security , after hezbollah 's 2006 war with israel .
read the full piece here .
paul danahar ( @ pdanahar ) was n't long ago that hezbollah was objecting to iran funding hamas because of hamas ' syria stand .
now besties again

the world health organization ( who ) called on friday for a humanitarian corridor to be set up in gaza to allow aid workers to evacuate the wounded and bring in life-saving medicines , reuters reports : even during wartime , belligerents are obligated under international humanitarian law to ensure that people are able to reach medical care in safety , the who and red cross said .
yet some sick and injured in gaza are dying because of a lack of access to ambulances or health facilities , or the inability to leave the enclave for specialized treatment , the agencies said .

as casualties mount daily , who officials have discussed the humanitarian corridor proposal with both israeli and egyptian officials , but there has been no response yet , who spokesman paul garwood said .
`` it 's needed as an urgency , '' garwood told a news briefing .
read the full piece here .
anne barnard of the new york times is in gaza .
`` just visited a psychologist in gaza who counsels trauma victims , '' she tweets .
`` his mother , 3 brothers , nephew & sister in law were killed in their house . ''
anne barnard ( @ abarnardnyt ) gaza psychologist who lost 6 in family says problem for therapists : you ca n't telll the trauma victim they 're now safe , even after ceasefire
the bbc 's jon donnison has a new line from the israeli police spokesman on who is responsible for the killing of three israeli teens last month .

`` israeli police mickeyrosenfeld tells me men who killed 3 israeli teens def lone cell , hamas affiliated but not operating under leadership , '' donnison tweets : jon donnison ( @ jondonnison ) seems to contradict the line from netanyahu government .
2/2 israeli police spokes mickey rosenfeld also said if kidnapping had been ordered by hamas leadership , they 'd have known about it in advance .
mickey rosenfeld said lone cells much harder to track .
said they would find whoever was now protecting the two suspects .
the israeli military says the number of soldiers killed in gaza is now 35 , after a soldier - not yet named , it appears - was killed friday afternoon in the gaza strip .

the idf tweeted a of what it says was rocket damage on a building in ashkelon hit friday morning : idf ( @ idfspokesperson ) a rocket fired from gaza hit an apartment building in the israeli city of ashkelon this morning .
the un now puts the number of displaced gazans at more than 150,000 .
update : the number has passed 160,000 : chris gunness ( @ chrisgunness ) 160,487 displaced people in 83 unrwa shelters in # gaza .
after beit hanoun none can be assumed safe ; a source of universal disgrace rt unrwa ( @ unrwa ) # gaza : 150,137 displaced palestinian civilians are seeking refuge in 84 unrwa shelters .
here 's a map locating the two fatal west bank shooting incidents in which five palestinians were reported killed .
map by paddy allen : update : this block has been updated .
earlier reports said four palestinians were killed in the shootings .
the figure has grown to five .
here is the latest ap account of the fatalities : palestinian hospital officials said three palestinians were killed in beit omar and two in hawara .
the mayor of hawara , mouin idmeidi , said he and hundreds of others from the village participated in a protest after emerging from a local mosque following friday noon prayers .
hawara is located along a main north-south thoroughfare that is also used by israeli motorists .
idmeidi said an israeli motorist slowed down as he passed the march and fired at the group .
the mayor said four people were wounded and that one of them , a 19-year-old , died at rafidiyeh hospital in nablus of his injuries .
after the shooting , clashes erupted between palestinians and israeli troops who opened fire , killing a 22-year-old from hawara , the mayor said .
rafidiyeh hospital confirmed the deaths .
in beit omar , clashes erupted between israeli forces and palestinian stone-throwers .
hebron hospital officials said three palestinians were killed .
the israeli military said it was looking into the reports .
a un team had to cut short a visit to the scene of thursday 's attack on a school in beit hanoun when it encountered gunfire , unrwa spokesperson chris gunness says in a statement .

the israeli army had been notified of the mission in advance , he says : at 1400 today an unrwa team which included an international weapons expert went to the school at beit hanoun which came under attack yesterday causing multiple deaths and injury .
the aim of the visit to the site was to survey the scene in the aftermath of the incident .
the israeli army had been notified in advance about the composition of the team , the time and purpose of the visit .
the mission had to be cut short and the team was forced to leave the area after gunfire around the school .
unrwa regrets not being able complete even this initial assessment .
we will attempt to visit the site when the situation allows .
we again underline our call for an immediate and comprehensive investigation .
chris gunness ( @ chrisgunness ) @ lrozen we do not know
the israeli army announced on friday that a soldier unaccounted for after an ambush in gaza six days ago was ascertained to be dead .
reuters reports : islamist militant group hamas said last sunday it had captured oron shaul , giving his name and army id number , but did not release a photograph of him in their hands .
the israeli military said a special committee had reviewed all the information available to them and had decided that shaul did not survive the assault , which killed six other soldiers .
`` the committee concluded that staff sergeant oron shaul is defined 'a soldier killed in action whose burial site is unknown ' , '' it said in a statement .
thirty-three israeli soldiers have been killed in the fighting in gaza , while rocket fire from gaza has killed two israeli civilians and a thai national .

as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : large protests in the west bank overnight were met with lethal force and at least four palestinians were killed , one by gunfire from a group of settlers .
the dead included hashem abu maria , a worker with the defence for children ngo .
strikes on gaza continued .
at least 832 gazans have been killed and 5,400 wounded , the health ministry says .
the israeli army announced the death of a 36-year-old reserve soldier , bringing the toll of soldiers killed in gaza since 8 july to 33 .
update : the number is 35 as of friday at noon et , the idf says .
pro-palestinian marches played around the world .
french authorities banned a demonstration planned in paris for saturday .
us secretary of state john kerry was expected to speak in cairo about a potential ceasefire plan .
elsewhere there was speculation that israel was preparing a new phase of its 'operation protective edge . '
witnesses at the unrwa shelter hit thursday said four blasts were heard simultaneously on the roof of the building and one blast hit a courtyard .
more here .
hashem abu maria , 46 , killed today in beit ummar near hebron by israeli soldiers , is reported to have worked with defence for children , an ngo for palestinian kids .
brad parker ( @ baparkr ) shocked to learn that @ twitterid colleague # hashemabumaria was killed by israeli forces in # beitommar .
devastating .

today 's death toll on the west bank has now reached four , afp reports , quoting palestinian security sources : in the first incident , 46-year-old hashem abu marieh and 30-year-old sultan yusef were killed in the palestinian village of beit ummar near the flashpoint southern city of hebron by israeli soldiers .
in the second incident , a group of settlers opened fire on protesting palestinians after they threw stones at their car near the northern west bank city of nablus .
the settler fire killed an 18-year-old palestinian named as khaled oudeh .
shortly afterwards , israeli troops arrived at the scene and clashed with the palestinians , firing live bullets and tear gas .
the israeli army fire killed a second palestinian , 22-year-old tayyib oudeh , the security sources said , adding that three other palestinians were injured by live fire .

sonia dridi ( @ sonia dridi ) ok so definitely tough negotiations spokesman of egy fm says `` come at 7.30 and press conf at 8.30pm '' # kerry # bankimoon # ceasefire sonia dridi ( @ sonia dridi ) press conf delayed till around 5.30 cairo time .
kerry waiting for an answer from hamas after he proposed a new `` formula '' for a ceasefire .
the twitter timeline of the france24 correspondent in egypt shows how kerry 's ceasefire negotiations appear to be going down to the wire .
egypt is two hours ahead of gmt .

graphic showing yesterday 's attack on a un shelter this updated graphic by my colleague , paddy allen , gives more details about the casualties yesterday at a school used as a un shelter for civilians , which appear likely to have been caused by israeli shells or mortars .
palestinians stand behind burning tyres during clashes following friday prayers in east jerusalem .
gharabli/afp/getty images there are quite a few coming of post-friday prayers clashes .
here 's one from jerusalem .
more indications - if any were needed - of the fast-rising tensions in the west bank .
reuters reports that three palestinians were shot dead there today , one apparently by a jewish settler near the city of nablus , with another killed shortly after during clashes with the military .
the third died in beit ummar , near hebron .

my colleague , saeed kamali dehghan , sends more about today 's pro-palestinian rallies in iran : in iran , hundreds of thousands of people participated in nationwide rallies held in solidarity with palestinians .
every year , iranians hold pro-palestinian demonstrations on the last friday of the fasting month of ramadan but this year violent events in gaza elicited what appeared to be a bigger turnout .
iran 's president , hassan rouhani , was among many senior officials who participated in friday 's rallies across iran .

such rallies , organised by the state , are often shunned by a large group of iranians , but this year a wider range of people , prompted by the extent of violence in gaza and israel , appeared to join in .
some iranians who never take part in state-organized rallies are taking to streets to sympathise with # gaza residents , '' tweeted a mahdi fattahi , who works for the associated press in tehran .
pictures taken by semi-official news agencies showed demonstrators holding banners such as one reading , stop killing babies in gaza . ''
a group of demonstrators , but not all , set fire to israeli flags and carried puppets of israeli and american officials .

earlier this week a group of prominent opposition activists in iran , many of whom have endured lengthy jail terms in recent years , protested in support of gazans in front of the un offices in tehran .
celebrated film-maker jafar panahi was among them .
iran 's nobel peace prize laureate , shirin ebadi , who currently lives in exile , also expressed serious concerns .
deliberate targeting of civilian areas by anyone is a violation of international law , '' she said in a joint statement signed by other nobel women prize winners .
israel 's continuing collective punishment of the palestinian people because of its ongoing war of attrition against hamas is a war crime . ''
some more details on casualties and rocket attacks from afp..
among those killed in gaza on friday were two women who died in an air strike , one of them pregnant..

the israeli army announced the death of a 36-year-old reserve soldier , bringing the toll of soldiers killed in gaza since 8 july to 33.. israel 's army said 25 rockets hit southern israel on friday with another 10 intercepted , since 8 july 1,870 rockets have struck israel , with another 473 intercepted by the iron dome defence system .

even if a lasting truce is agreed - and that remains very far from certain - to an extent the problems in gaza are only just beginning , as reuters points out here : at least 2,655 homes have been totally or severely damaged , while another 3,175 are damaged but not beyond use , the un said .
bombs have lashed 116 schools and 18 health centres , stadiums , playgrounds , mosques , roads , phone towers , water lines , sewage treatment plants and police stations .
the cost of rebuilding gaza homes destroyed so far in israeli bombing amounts to $ 800 million - the whole of gaza 's annual budget - the palestinian housing minister told reuters .
mufeed al-hasayna said he could not yet calculate the damage to public buildings or infrastructure , adding that it had received precious little foreign aid to help recovery after past wars .
`` we can not make a definite estimate under fire once the war is over , the ministry plans to call on all the countries of the world to assist in the rebuilding of gaza . ''
the labour leader , ed miliband , is making a major speech in london right now .

while largely devoted to domestic issues it will also touch on gaza , my colleague patrick wintour reports : ed miliband today called on israel and hamas to agree a ceasefire and allow the international community access to gaza to provide medical help to the wounded .
the labour leader also again opposed the israeli incursion into gaza , saying that whatever the provocation it was leading a cycle of violence .

insisting he was speaking `` as a friend of israel and a friend of the palestinian people '' , miliband said hamas rocket attacks were unjustifiable and act of terror , but at the same time he said the attack by israel was leading to a mounting death toll which could not be justified .
he said : `` i defend israel 's right to defend itself and it people against these attacks . ''

but he went on to say that labour `` opposed this latest israeli incursion into gaza because , despite the provocation from hamas , we feared it would lead to the further deaths of the innocent , fail to act as a deterrent and simply risk recruiting more people to the cause of hamas '' .
he continued : `` the tragedy yesterday at the un school is a horrific example of what we feared : the death , destruction and mayhem resulting from the escalation of violence .
this is a cycle of violence that has spiralled out of control . ''
he warned : `` hundreds have died , the great majority innocent civilians .
and with every hour the casualties rise .

the international community must be allowed immediate access to provide medical assistance to the wounded and in the longer term reconstruction of destroyed homes , hospitals , schools and infrastructure .
`` but above all , both sides must realise that there can be no military solution to this conflict .
i urge them to take a step back and return to a different logic - the logic of deescalation , of ceasefire , of an end to the killing . ''

miliband said : `` europe has a responsibility : to support the united states in seeking that ceasefire and meaningful negotiations around a two state solution , which is the only sustainable route to securing security for israel and a viable state for the palestinian people . ''
nadav eyal ( @ nadaveyaldesk ) sources : netanyahu basically accepts kerry 's cease fire , works to push it in cabinet , positive signal from qatar as to mashal .
we are close .
see also this tweet from an israeli tv journalist .
there are suddenly a fair few- so far of the record and unconfirmed - reports that a ceasefire could be imminent .
the israeli newspaper , haarezt , has this on its live blog : intensive diplomatic efforts underway to bring about ceasefire ; kerry spearheading efforts to announce truce shortly .
john kerry , who remains in cairo , has held talks today with the un chief , ban ki-moon , and egypt 's foreign minister , sameh shoukri , afp reports .
the us secretary of state , who has also been talking by phone with his counterparts from turkey and qatar , is trying to broker a ceasefire for gaza .
he will speak to reporters later today , before possibly flying home .
people in tehran take part in an anti-israeli rally .

taherkenareh/epa there have been several protests globally today against israel 's action in gaza , including in bangkok , tokyo , kabul and the one above in tehran , the latter marking `` qods day '' , an annual show of solidarity by iran with the palestinians .
hamas says it has fired three rockets at tel aviv airport , a day after many airlines resumed flights there , afp reports .
it quotes this statement from the group 's armed wing : at 11:45 am ( 0845 gmt ) , the qassam brigades bombarded ben gurion airport with three m75 rockets .
a spokeswoman for israel 's military confirmed renewed rocket fire from gaza but did not say how close any had come to the airport .
the military says two rockets were shot down over tel aviv .
interview with the hamas leader , khaled meshaal .

here 's an extract from a bbc news interview with the hamas leader , khaled meshaal , who reiterates that the group is seeking a lifting of the israeli blockade on gaza as a precondition for any ceasefire .

jonathan miller ( @ millerc4 ) # c4news at scene of qalandia riot , spent cases of live rounds used by israelis , who shot around 150 palestinians another tweet from channel 4 news 's jonathan miller , who shows bullet casings at the scene of last night 's protests , and notes the seemingly large number of people shot .
jonathan miller ( @ millerc4 ) # c4news dir of ramallah hosp says they were `` overwhelmed '' last night .
total 234 admitted here .
most gunshot .
1 died , shot x3 ; 7 v critical jonathan miller from britain 's channel 4 news has been to ramallah 's hospital to see those injured in last night 's protests .
more diplomatic moves are afoot to seek a ceasefire .
afp reports that turkey 's foreign minister , ahmet davutoglu , has cancelled a trip to france and gone to qatar - the leader of hamas , khaled meshaal is based in doha - to try to bolster efforts .
a turkish official said the move followed phone conversations davutoglu had with the us secretary of state , john kerry , and his counterpart in qatar , and talks with palestinian groups .
the live blog on the website of the israeli newspaper haarezt says sirens in israel to warn of incoming hamas rockets have sounded in tel aviv and a series of other place .
two rockets were intercepted by israel 's defence system , with another causing damage to a house in the coastal city of ashkelon .
palestinian women makes their way through an israeli checkpoint has they head to the al-aqsa mosque in jerusalem for friday prayers .
al-shaaer/afp/getty images it 's almost midday in gaza , and people have been arriving for friday prayers .
this is a map showing the location of the un shelter struck on thursday , by my colleague paddy allen .
israeli police are making preparations to try and quell renewed protests today , afp reports .
police will bar men under 50 from jerusalem 's al-aqsa mosque for prayers on the last friday of the ramadan .
a police spokesman , micky rosenfeld said : different units have been mobilised in and around the old city .
we 're prepared to deal with any disturbances the agency has named one of the men killed in protests overnight as mohammed al-aaraj , 25 .
it says five of the injured are in a critical conditio , some shot by live ammunition .
a palestinian man reads the koran with his daughter at a un school in jabalia , north gaza , which is being used as a civilian shelter .
longari/afp/getty images

while the bulk of flights have resumed to israel after the european aviation safety agency lifted a recommendation for airlines to avoid tel aviv airport after a hamas missile landed nearby this week , germany 's two largest airlines have not yet followed suit .
air berlin says flights to tel aviv remain suspended until at least midday today , with lufthansa saying all today 's flights to tel aviv are cancelled , ap reports .
this morning 's daily mail has a comment piece indicative of the difficult time currently faced by some supporters of israel .
the british newspaper is habitually pro-israel , as is the writer of the article , journalist and historian max hastings .
but the headline reads : `` i 've always loved israel but this brutality breaks my heart . ''
here 's a brief extract : were the world 's attention not overwhelmingly fixed on the fate of flight mh17 , it would have more to say about that of the palestinian inhabitants of gaza .
bombed and battered by israeli air and firepower , they are dying in scores , victims alike of their own leadership and israeli ruthlessness .
some of the dead are hamas fighters .
but many others are women , children , the helpless old .
israel is exacting vengeance at its usual tariff for hamas rocketing , and the murder of three israeli students by terrorists .
for each israeli killed , the lives of many times that number of palestinians are forfeit .
israel says : they started it ; we have a right to retribution .
but much of the world says : the jewish people have been historic standard-bearers for civilisation .

does prime minister benjamin netanyahu 's campaign in gaza represent that israel 's tragedy is that the only democracy in the middle east has fallen prey to a succession of right-wing governments , which derive much of their electoral strength from russian emigres and extremist religious parties .

a historian friend , himself a jew and an uncommonly astute observer of the world , said to me a while back : 'consciously or unconsciously , israel has decided that it prefers a state of permanent war to making the concessions to the palestinians that would be indispensable to any chance of peace . '
israel 's military is claiming it has killed a senior member of the radical group islamic jihad , the jerusalem post reports .
salah abu hasnin was killed in his home in rafah this morning , the paper said , saying hasnin was a member of islamic jihad 's supreme military council .
meanwhile a live blog on the haaretz website cities palestinian officials as saying 20 people have been killed in gaza in the past few hours .
it also quotes a senior israeli military official as saying the two palestinian protesters killed in the west bank overnight had `` opened fire with a kalachnikov , from inside the riots . ''
a wounded palestinian youth is brought to ramallah city hospital after being injured during protests on the west bank .

momani/afp/getty images an israeli security officer walks past burning tires as palestinian protesters march on the west bank momani/afp/getty images here 's a couple more photos from last night 's west bank protests .
what seems apparent is that the attack on the un shelter , and the appalling civilian casualties it brought , has hardened some attitudes towards israel 's action .

baroness valerie amos , the british peer who is now the un 's under-secretary for humanitarian affairs , spoke to my colleague justin mccurry in tokyo earlier today , calling the strike on the school `` appalling '' and warning that conditions for civilians at un shelters were deteriorating amid shortages of food and water .
she said : the blatant violations of international humanitarian and human rights law have been pointed out very clearly by the un 's commissioner for human rights .
gaza is so crowded that it 's hard to avoid hitting civilian targets , that 's why the number of civilian deaths continues to rise .
but i have n't up from colleagues [ in gaza ] that the un is being deliberately targeted .
read the full story here .

ap is quoting an anonymous israeli defence official , who says the country 's security cabinet will meet today in private to discuss renewed international efforts to broker a ceasefire in the wake of yesterday 's strike on a gaza school used as a un shelter for civilians , which killed at least 15 people .
however , the official said that the meeting would also discuss the option of expanding israel 's eight-day ground offensive .
there was no comment from the office of israel 's prime minister , benjamin netanyahu .

reuters has also been speaking to an unnamed official , quite possibly the same one , who said an envisaged ceasefire would last seven days , permitting aid to reach gaza and casualties to be treated .

the country also wanted to hear any palestinian response to overtures from the us secretary of state , john kerry , who has been busily working the phones from egypt , the official added : first israel wants to hear hamas 's response to the ( kerry ) proposals .
thus far hamas has said any lasting ceasefire would be conditional on israel easing its blockade of gaza .
overnight the west bank saw some of the biggest protests in several years as around 10,000 palestinian protesters marched from east jerusalem .
at least two marchers were killed and 200 wounded , with israel 's military saying it had used `` riot dispersal means '' to combat crowds blocking roads with burning tyres and throwing rocks .
it is expected that we could see more protests in the west bank and east jerusalem following noon prayers today , the last friday of ramadan .
the palestinian authority has called for a day of rage '' over israel 's military action in gaza .
since 8 july , more than 800 palestinians and 33 israelis have died .

there will also be significant diplomatic action today in the wake of yesterday 's apparent israeli strike on a school in gaza being used as a un shelter for civilians , which killed more than 15 people and injured around 200 .
here 's our report this morning from peter beaumont in gaza city and harriet sherwood in jerusalem .

Diplomatic meetings to resume at weekend in Paris.
Reports of a planned 12-hour 'pause' in Israeli strikes Saturday.
Israeli defense minister says ground operation may 'significantly broaden' soon.
At least five Palestinians killed as thousands march in West Bank.
Hezbollah leader vows support for 'our brothers in Gaza'
